intro: Myrsine novocaledonica subsp. kaalaensis, commonly known as the Kaala myrsine, is a shrub native to New Caledonia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves with a glossy surface. The plant produces small white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by dark blue berries. It thrives in moist, shaded environments within its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
